result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chase W Bedney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Justice point discharge summary received and filed. lr
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Patrick Cavanaugh Brennan in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr
Court ordered no use or possession of marijuana or oxycodone.

Defendant Chase W Bedney in court with attorney Patrick c. Brennan.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Bail motion for cash bail by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requested a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request and ordered another Bail/Bond Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chase W Bedney in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Chase W Bedney in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Patrick W. Brennan in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Defendant Chase W Bedney in court with attorney Patrick W. Brennan.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status  in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense filed request for substitution of attorney , received and filed. lr

Defendant Chase W Bedney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Chase W Bedney in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Chase W Bedney in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
